children.text: This now gives the person you are talking to context about the choices you are making.  It also opens the door for you to be

.  It gives them the chance to say I hear that is important please hear me out on my want. Or to disagree with your assessment of the situation. In short, it gives them information and an invitation to engage.
In step one, you empowered yourself by establishing that your actions are yours, in step two you empower others by giving them the opening to talk about why you might be wrong.
Using "have to" might feel like a shortcut but in the end, it only shortcuts agency.
